lines.text: [Geri and Mel B are playing chess on the Spice Bus]
Check!
What do you mean check?
I mean, check. My bishop's got your king.
Where?
There! You've either got to move it in front, or move it out of the way.
Well I'll move that fairground horse to there. Sort that out!
You can't do that!
Says who?
Says Mr. Chess! It's been in the rules for thousands of years!
Well I'm gonna break the rules and set this little fairground horse free amonst all these little square fields, like that. There!
I'm gonna slap you in a minute!

[Sarcastically]
Oh.
In my bed, I've got two teddies, I've got a rabbit, I've got two dollies, and one Susan, she's got a bad eye,
[they cut to other peoples' conversations then back to Emma, still talking]
and then I've got a green giraffe which I won at a fair, he was the only one left, I felt *really* sorry for him,
[cuts back and forth, again]
then there's Buzz, Woody, the alien, and then I've got a fluffy pink hot water bottle. So, there's just not enough room for you, mate!
[pats him on the shoulder which is sweaty and then looks a the sweat that's now on her hand]
... ugh!
When the rabbit of chaos is pursued by the ferret of disorder through the fields of anarchy, it is time to hang your pants on the hook of darkness. Whether they're clean or not.
We're the Spice Girls, yes indeed. Just Girl Power is all we need. We know how we got this far.
Strength and courage and a Wonderbra!
Would this work with only one?
Just with me I have no fun.
Would this work with only two?
We need more for what we do.
Would this work with only three?
Three's a crowd, bad company.
Would this work with only four?
No way, girl, we need one more!
Listen up, take my advice - we need five for the power of Spice. Give it up, give it out, take a stand, scream and shout! One, two, three, four, five Spice Girls!
You don't have a life. You have a schedule.
The headless chicken can only know where he's been. He can't see where he's going.
Does anyone know how to deliver a baby?
Don't worry, I know all about home delivery.
Yeah, right.
Well, I read it in a book. Okay, the first thing to do is put your legs together!
Well that's a bit late! She should have done that nine months ago!
Don't make me laugh, please.
Do not make her laugh, else it'll just shoot out like a cannon ball!
Seriously, what if the baby comes out right now?
Well it's not gonna go very far. I mean, look, she's still got her tights on!

[shouting up Nicola's skirt]
Stay up there! We're not ready for you yet!
Or if they find a cure for Déjà Vu?

[scoffs]
Not me.
Or if they find a cure for Déjà Vu?

[scoffs]
Not me.

[exasperated]
How can all the toilets break down at once?

It's not my fault. Hey, it's hard enough to get a plumber to come to your house, and that stays in one place. But you try getting a plumber to come to a bus that's driving all over the countryside. It's impossible.

[frustrated]
Well, can't you do something about it?

[confused]
Like what?

[he means fix the toilets, not "fix" the girls so they can't pee]
Fix them!
Hey man, I love these girls, and I'd do anything for them. But I won't do that.
Now that's Girl Power.
Okay, girls, that was absolutely perfect without really being any good at all.

[after Posh and the 2 young fans fall into the Thames]
I want a close up of that wet infant!
Look, Piers, I'm only getting you shouting.
Well, shush then!

[Yelling]
Righty horrible, lot! Left, right, left, ooh! Ah! Don't give me any of that Julie Andrews hilltop clap trap! I'm your mother now, and I don't mean superior
[Yelling at Baby Spice]
Take that sweet out of your mouth
[Starts rambling incoherently, then starts half galloping]
Right. Now Shootanoo. Shendy. Shendy. Shendy. Shend.
Are you the dance teacher, Mr. Step?

[Stops in front of Ginger Spice]
That is correct. I'm going to show you pore du bra. Well, that wouldn't really apply to you.
[Ginger Spice looks at her breasts, Mr. Step starts dancing, and the girls attempt to follow along]
Oh. Mama. Oh, Ma. Oh, oh, oh Mama. Mama. Oh ma. Mama.
[Stops dancing]
You know, we can't dance like that.
Yes, I know, I've seen your videos.
[Starts laughing]
This is ridiculous. Let's just do our own thing.
Ah! Don't even understand things, they're so strange. That's it, we're gonna get fit, fit, fit, fit, fit! One, two, one, two, three four...
[the girls start dancing, Mr. Step notices and decides to go along with it]
One, two, one, two, three, four. One, two, one, two, three, four. One, two, one, two, three, four. One, two, one, two, three, four.

[singing]
Never give up on the good times, gotta believe in the love you find. Never give up on the good times, living it up is a state of mind

[Starts marching, the girls follow]
I love it! Make your mother proud of you. What sort of men are you anyway/ left, right, left, right, left, right. Left, right, left, right, left, right. Right then, Spice Girls, regimental calls!

[after being kissed by The Spice Girls]
Whoo!

Emma, Victoria, Melvin C., Melvin B., Geri. You've been charged with releasing a single that is by no means as kicking as your previous records. Nor does it have such a dirty phat bass line. You are sentenced to having your next record enter the charts at 179 and having it fall completely out the following week.
[bangs the gavel]
Call Hootie and the Blowfish!
Look at this! Front page news, again. Suppose the whole lot of you'd been drowned.
Well, we weren't though, were we?
Speak for yourself.
What did you think you were doing? Going off like that?
We were just having fun!
What?
Fun! You know, like ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!
Look, Clifford, we're old enough to take responsibility for our own lives, do you know what I mean?
You don't have a life, you have a schedule! You are part of a well-oiled, global machine! There are people everywhere working their butts off for you! People like Deborah, here.
Oh, can we leave my butt out of this, please?
Oh, just don't be so uptight, Clifford.
Uptight? Uptight? You've got a live gig here tomorrow. It's my job to see that you turn up. My bum is on the line, here!
Can you please leave butts and bums out of this, for one minute?
Clifford, some things are more important than gigs, you know.
Like what?
Like self respect and our freedom, for a start!
Yeah, and friendship!
What are you saying? You-you don't want to turn up here, tomorrow night?

[defiantly]
Well, maybe we don't.
What'd you say that for?
I don't know, I just said it.
You could always take your shirt off Geri.
Shut up.
It was just a joke.
They're hot, Chief! They've got fire in their eyes, hunger in their bellies and great big shoes on their feet!
We're cooking here. This is a stew, a gumbo, a jambalaya, if you will. We're just jamming.
Boys, boys! Calm down! Haven't you ever heard of the word "compromisation"?
No. We didn't agree to have this lot dancing with us.
I mean I know you said it was going to be tacky. But this is tacky.
You know, I'm always gonna be known as Baby Spice, even when I'm 30!
You love it really Emma, you you play up to it all the time.
No I don't!
Yes you do.You're doing it now.
I'm not!
He didn't mean that!

[defiantly]
Oh, didn't I?

[Tearfully]
Look, can we please stop arguing?
When you know exactly what we're supposed to be doing. Will somebody please let me know?
[she storms off]

[Angrily]
Oh great, Clifford! Now look what you've gone and done!
Well, that's just too bad!
Well yeahj it is too bad cos you know what? I'm going home now, see ya!
[follows Victoria]
Bye!
Look can we stop? All this, this is doing my head in.
[exits]
[follows her bandmate in concern]
Emma!
[runs after her]
[a long oause ensues, and only Geri is left]
I hope you know what you're doing, cos if you're looking for a fight. you're gonna lose!
[the keyboardist has just made a mistake]
Hold on, hold on. What's going on?
What are you doing, duh?
Sort your fingers out, dude!
Or have you got boxing gloves on?

[after the girls hear noises in the night and after running into each other and scaring themselves, seek refuge in Victoria's room]
It's pathetic, you know, that we can't even sleep in our own rooms
Yeah, I don't know what we're making such a fuss for, it's only an old house!
A big old house

[very scared]
A big old scary haunted, big old house!

[as Sporty Spice]
Hup! Hup! Hup! I'm so Sporty!
[Kicks at the camera]
Ha! Hup! Hup!

[as Scary Spice]
Rah!

[as Baby Spice]
My mummy's my best friend. Shh!

[as Posh Spice]
I'm just too Posh.

[as Sporty Spice]
When's Liverpool gonna win the cup, like, eh?

[as Scary Spice]
Are we finished yet?

[as Ginger Spice]
Um, blah, blah, blah. And, Girl Power. Feminism, d'you know what I mean?

[as Scary Spice]
Oh no!

[as Sporty Spice, jumps onto the runway]
Yo!

[as Ginger Spice]
I feel as though I'm bein' strangled. How do you feel?

[as Posh Spice]
Really uncomfortable!

[as Baby Spice]
Well, I just nearly fell off these shoes and sprained my ankles.

[as Scary Spice]
These things are really tight. They go right up my bum.

[as Sporty Spice]
There are really comfy, actually.

[as Posh Spice]
Don't even think about it!

[as Scary Spice]
I'm off. I'm gettin' these off! Bring me some platforms

[as Ginger Spice]
How can you wear these things?

[as Sporty Spice]
You look a pile of crap in my clothes, anyway.
Well done girls, excellent performance
What are you talking about, you weren't even watching Clifford!
Yes I was!
Don't lie, no you weren't!
I sensed the vibes! I have an excellent vibe sensor right here
Yeah right.
He just doesn't love us anymore!
Oh yes I do. I love you like a wildebeest loves five lionesses chewing at his legs!
Rawr!
[Clifford sits silently backstage, panicked that the girls really aren't going to show up for the concert. Finally he speaks to the documentary camera]
Okay. So this is the plan. The band starts up, the fans go wild, the lights come on, and I walk center stage and hang myself.
[to the camera man]
Oh by the way this is my good side.
[back to the audience]
My final words are, "The Spice Girls? I hate them!"
[Suddenly the girls burst through the door shouting and laughing]
Hey! What you doing sitting around?
Come on! We got a show to do!
How ya doing?
Where are the mics?
Where are the clothes!
And where are the bacon butties?
I love those girls! I love those girls!
Oy, don't you be starting on Capricorns.

[after falling into the bus]
Victoria!
Sorry!

[Describing the events as they are happening]
Now they're coming up on the tower bridge.
Attention, please. Your attention, please. The bridge will shortly be lifted.
The road is rising right in front of them to let a boat through!
The bridge is going up!
They can't believe it!
Oh, my god! I don't believe it!
Are they crazy enough to try and jump the gap?
[Sporty, Baby, Ginger, and Scary put on their "game faces"]
Hold onto your knickers, girls!
Hey, baby! These are the Spice Girls, of course they're gonna go for it! Up it goes. A five ton London bus sailing through the air at seventy miles an hour! It's incredible!
It's expensive!
[the Spice Bus easily jumps the gap]
Um... not necessarily.
But then, just when you think they're safe, they discover the bomb.
What bomb?
[Opens up a secret door, looks at the bomb, and screams]
That bomb.
[All scream]
Why?
Those are the rules.
My god, I've had enough of the rules!
[Attempts to choke Graydon, but Clifford holds him back]
What are you trying to do, kill them? No more! They've suffered enough! Please!
All right! All right! They... they run up the steps to the Albert Hall, zoom past the guards, hurdle down the corridor, and they burst through that door right there.
[Points to the door]

[Watches the door, expecting to see the Spice Girls run in. When they don't, he attemspt to choke Graydon. Martin tries to hold him back]
You lied to me!
Hey! Hey! Hey, now! Hey! Hey! That's enough of that!
Where are they?

[Still choking]
I'll rewrite it.

[the girls are in the woods at night and frightened]
Something just pushed past me, and I'm not joking!
Probably one of those disgusting beasts want to eat you.

[frightened]
Ugh!

[the girls hear a loud, strange noise that sounds like a fart]
Oh pack it in, Mel!

[indignantly]
It wasn't me!

[the girls see a spaceship]
What's that?
Oh my God, run for it!
I can't move!
[the aliens land their spaceship and walk out]
[in alien language]
It's them! It's them! Look!

[in alien language]
Are you sure?

[in alien language]
Yes! There's the little blonde one.

[in alien language]
That's what you said before - and it was a sheep!

[one of the aliens tries to touch Scary's breast]
Oi! Get off!

[exasperated]
Mel, you've done it now!

[in alien language]
I told you shake hands!

[in unintelligible alien language]
Can I have your autograph? It's not for me, it's for my brother.
What's his name?

[in unintelligible alien language]
Krtkkarphillmuk.

[confused]
Is that three or four K's?
Something's happening to me. What is it?
You're smiling, sir.
[the Spice Girls have all just stormed out after a huge row about an incident where they ran off with two competition winners and several of them fall into the River Thames]
So what do you think? No I don't want to hear what you think?
[pauses]
What do you think?
I think you have definitely, definitely lost
I think I may have just started the breakup of The Spice Girls

[as Deborah stalks off]
AAAAAAGGGGHHHHHHH!
What? Act? Did anyone care if Marilyn Monroe could act? All they cared was, "Was she in focus?"
The answer is no Clifford.
Chief?
The girls can't have the morning off.
We've got to see Nicola in the morning. The baby's overdue.
Babies are allowed to be overdue you're not.

[singing while inquiring of three getting in on one ticket]
Tonight is the night when three become one.
I told them before. If they wanted to be spontaneous they had to clear it with me first.

[after doing Bob's hair]
Right! Now, you look great!

[looking at his hair in a mirror]
What the hell have you done?
Now hear this. It is dangerous to leave moisturising cream in the refrigerator, as it could be mistaken for mayonaisse. That is all.
That's it, push!
I am pushing!
Are you sure she should be pushing?
Well what else is she gonna do?

[looking down at the male dancer's crotch area]
Think that's real down there?
Looks like a pair of rolled up socks to me.
Is it a boy or a girl?
It's a beetroot!
It's a girl!
Dennis pull over.
[rolls his eyes and pulls over]
The girls need to go to the bathroom again.

[as they discuss further movie roles in the end credit]
And I don't want to me nice all the time. Maybe I could slap somebody, like Victoria here.

[indignantly]
Emma!
[the two competition winners and Victoria are being pulled back onto their boat after taking a tumble into the River Thames]
Vicky, Vicky, you want to wear this?
[offers her jacket]

[venomously]
I'm not that desperate, thank you!

[as they are talking about being stereotyped]
You know, I think it's the same with fish
[points out fish in tank]
I mean, look at this, you've got the spotty one, that's wacky. You've got the fluffy one, that's cute And then you have this ugly loser one. That reminds me of my ex boyfriend, Steven.
Ugh
Did you know that the largest fish ever is the manta ray?

[Sarcastically]
And then you've got the little ginger one, which is full of useless information, about manta rays!

[Who Do You Think You Are plays]
I love this song.
That's cause we wrote it.
But you do like boys, don't you, Geri?
C'mon.
[Sarcastically]
Is the Pope a Catholic?
Apparently he is, yes.

[the next day]
And now, the latest news concerning the Spice Girls have questioned the religious conviction of the Pope, but suggesting that he might not be Catholic. We asked the Bishop of Candlemen what he thought.

It's a terrible suggestion! Almost blasphemous! Of course the Pope's a Catholic, otherwise he wouldn't've been invited to become Pope, would he? I'd like to know what evidence the Spice Girls have to support these allegations! I really would!

[Describes what's going on throughout the entire scene]
He crashes to the ground. And now the girls come face-to-face with their tabloid tormentor. The evil reporter has been unmaksed and in that moment, Damien's whole worthless life flashes before his eyes because, the girls have made him realize that he's been living a meaningless lie.

[Lying on the ground, in pain]
Oh, d'you know what, girls... you've made me realize... I've been... living a meaningless lie.
It's his character's one defining moment, and there isn't a dry seat in the house.
I'm wet already.
So, then what? Is that the end?
No! Damien goes after the really big evil boss, McMaxford.
Well, what about the girls?
Well, the girls, they've gotta get to Albert Hall, right? I mean, they've been at the hospital for twelve hours.
Dennis!
Out of the ways girls?
What are you doing?
Fasten your seatbelts.
[Gets in the driver's seat of the Spice Bus, puts her seatbelt on, presses down on the gas pedal, and starts driving like a lunatic]

[Getting up off the ground]
Hey! That's my bus!
Come on! What are you doing? What's the matter, are you blind? Come on, what are you doing? Get out of the way! Get out of the way! Sunday drivers! It's only Saturday!

And now the Spice Bus is racing across London, through Trafalger's Square. Pigeons are flying up. Guys are diving into fountains. And as it zooms through them all, past Bukingham Palace, Prince William is there. He's looin' at the window through a curtain. He turns to the Queen! The Queen, man! And he says "Oi, granny, look. It's the Spice Girls. They're on telly in a minute". And the Queen looks out and says "Oh, you're right. Isn't that the Posh one drivin'?"
Look, there's the Queen! Hi, William!
Hi, Charlie.
Hello, Harry.
And then, suddenly, they're on top of the bus.
Why?
The rules!

Right, right, the rules. Anyhow, there they are, standing in gale-force winds. Holding on for dear life. Emma slips, but Geri grabs her. But then Geri slips, so Mel B grabs her. But then, she slips, so Mel C grabs her. Four? Wait, that's four. Oh, there's one driving, right. Anyway, they're standing on top of a bus, whiplashing back and forth, about to be turned into Spice Jam!
Oh, my god!
And...?
Two old nuns in a mini-metro pull up right in front of them. The braking tumbles the girls back into the bus.
Your mother.
My mother?
Si.
[through his megaphone]
Your mother.

[in closing credits, to Deborah]
"All right, sweetheart!" That's from that film you did.
Come on, Clifford. Don't you remember being a kid?

[glares]
What?
You know? Fooling around on the playground, scrapping your knee.
Deborah, what planet are you from?

[after Sporty, Posh, and two fans have fallen into the Thames from a boat]
Help!
What, what?
This dress is dry clean only Melanie!
[Sporty makes an exasperated sound]
Do they have sharks in the Thames?
Oh, shut up!

[the girls are talking about male and female body language]
Apparently there are these animals in the jungle or the rainforest or somewhere like that. Anyway, when the male's courting the female, he goes up to her and pees on her.
[the rest of the girls make disgusted noises]
Geri, did you have to?
No, but it's his way of showing he fancies her, and the thing is, they get it on afterwards and mate.
Well, called me old fashioned but I'd much prefer a bunch of flowers.
Why Milan, Clifford?
Just a TV special. Italians, screaming fans, the usual thing.
Are we there yet?

[finding Clifford alone in a bar]
I thought i'd find you here.
Sorry, there's only room for one depressed personality here.
Come on, Clifford. At least you're still alive.
That's the bit that depresses me.
If it makes you feel better, I have a degree in politics, philosophy and economics, and I spend my entire life worrying wether Mel C. is wearing the right Nike Air Max.
By the way, did you sort them out yet?
Yes.
Whoo.
Mind you, I'd rather be us than the girls. Fame is such a fickle thing.
So, what can I get you?
Gin and Tonic, please. Wait a minute. Make that a double.
Yes.
You know what happens now, don't you?
What's That?
We sit here more and more self-pitying, telling tragic tales of lost lovers, and deaden the night with bursting passion and ruining our professional relationship.
I'm up for that.
Was that really worth it?
I'm so glad we've got the morning off.
Yeah. First time in over a month, Clifford.
Are we there yet?

[in closing credits, to Deborah]
We needed a serious actress like you to give it some depth, because we didn't want it to be.
Superficial.
Just a minute.
[turns around]
I love you.
[UK Version]
Next stop. Publicity party. Beautiful people, reporters, lots of finger food, have fun. That is all.
